page.title: 09TRANSPORT AND COMMUNICATION
page.content: It is easy to reach major towns like Nottingham, Hull, Sheffield and Leicester. All these are between 1\_2hrs drive away if you use the main roads such as the A46 to Nottingham. London is about 130 miles away. It takes about an hour to reach the A1, but this road takes you straight into the capital. We asked people how they travelled within Lincolnshire: 50% used cars,40% used buses which they said were reasonable for the price of petrol, which is Â£1.95 per gallon. The Post Office delivers with one trolley, three bikes and two vans. One big lorry comes daily from London to collect the overseas and non_local post. Horncastle has one telephone exchange which covers five telephone boxes, one with a phone card slot, and approximately 1555 private phones.
